humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The largest tumor in this report is carcinoma number one in the left breast, which measures 2.6 x 2.5 x 1.5 cm. According to the rules provided, a T2 tumor is more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage for cancer is determined by the size of the tumor. In this report, there are three separate foci of breast carcinoma in the left breast. The largest tumor (lesion #2) has a greatest dimension of 2.8 cm, which falls in the T2 category (tumor size 2.1 to 5.0 cm). Therefore, the T stage for this patient is T2.
